intro: Proustia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf proustia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
